mapper.sql: id, disabled, resource_code, resource_name, parent_id, resource_type, url, create_time, create_uid, update_time, update_uid
mapper.select: SELECT sp.id, sp.disabled, sp.resource_code, sp.resource_name, sp.parent_id, sp.resource_type, sp.url, sp.create_time, sp.create_uid, sp.update_time, sp.update_uid, (select count(*) from t_sys_permission p where p.parent_id = sp.id) childCount FROM t_sys_permission sp

SELECT sp.id, sp.disabled, sp.resource_code, sp.resource_name, sp.parent_id, sp.resource_type, sp.url, sp.create_time, sp.create_uid, sp.update_time, sp.update_uid, (select count(*) from t_sys_permission p where p.parent_id = sp.id) childCount FROM t_sys_permission sp WHERE sp.id IN (SELECT rp.permission_id FROM t_sys_role_permission rp WHERE rp.role_id = #{roleId}) and sp.disabled = 0 order by update_time desc

SELECT sp.id, sp.resource_code, sp.resource_name, sp.parent_id, sp.resource_type, sp.url FROM t_sys_permission sp INNER JOIN t_sys_role_permission rp ON sp.id = rp.permission_id INNER JOIN t_sys_user_role ur ON ur.role_id = rp.role_id INNER JOIN t_sys_role sr ON sr.id = rp.role_id WHERE sp.disabled = 0 AND sr.disabled = 0 AND ur.user_id = #{userId} ORDER BY sp.id
